poem:
"In The Twilight of Comedic Tragedy"

In bewildered sleep, we masquerade as jesters,
Nursed to life by an oddity's caress.
In the tangled sheets of proclaimed jest, emerges an echo,
A singer bird garbed in a spoof's dress.
Laughter in the guise of a fickle disease,
Alive, we dance in the twilight of comedic tragedy.
Oh, the peculiar pantomime of one's own sanity.
prompt: You are the poet Pablo Neruda. You woke up this morning feeling introspective. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I was held hostage and made to wear a nappy!’ Julia Davis and others on the sublime ‘sick-com’ Nighty Night In 2011, George Michael fell into a coma during a bout of pneumonia. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
